etymology.interpretation: The character 羊(yáng, 'sheep') visually represents the head of a sheep or ram, capturing the animal's distinctive features. It serves as a straightforward pictogram, portraying one of the common animals in ancient agrarian societies.

examples.chinese: 农场里有羊(農場裡有羊)。
examples.english: There are sheep on the farm.

examples.chinese: 春天来了(春天來了)，羊群在草地上吃草(羊群在草地上吃草)。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān lái le, yángqún zài cǎodì shàng chī cǎo.
examples.english: In spring, the flock of sheep grazes on the meadow.

examples.chinese: 那只羊看起来很温顺(那隻羊看起來很溫順)。
examples.pinyin: Nà zhī yáng kàn qǐlái hěn wēnshùn.
